WRITING.TITLE: b'is Alprazolam very addictive?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Very new user here. Prescription is 0.4mg before sleep, did next to nothing. Took 2mg yesterday with alcohol (not much) and slept for 16hours straight. Took 2mg tonight again with alcohol (not much) and it did nothing, it's 6am and I had no sleep at all.  So what's wrong with this drug?! I've seen many stories accusing benzos for ruining their lives, but it would be sadder still for me if I'm addicted and still can't get any sleep

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I'm from China

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: But I was prescribed daily usage\xe2\x80\xa6 and 0.4 doesn't work at all while 2 (yeah I took 5 tablets yesterday) put me to sleep for 16 hours something I surely wasn't expecting either. I guess I shall talk to the doctor about it\xe2\x80\xa6

WRITING.TITLE: b'Got prescribed alprazolam for the first time'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: It's supposed to help me sleep and I'm told to take one 0.4mg tablet every evening. The thing is that 0.4 really did next to nothing to me (I had after all 4 hours sleep perhaps I should be grateful?).    Anyways I started looking for more informations on the drug and omg benzo recovery is a thing\xe2\x80\xa6!   Before this I was prescribed zolpidem once, it really helped, and tbh it also made me feel like I'm drunk (in a good, pleasant way). Btw zolpidem is highly restricted where I live.  I guess what I want to ask is: is alprazolam very addictive? I'm seen many posts accusing the drug of ruining their lives, I'd still prefer not going down that path if I have a choice.   That said I've doubled my dose today and am planning on taking a third (it's 0.4mg for heaven's sake) and am drinking with it (very light beer only)  Am I showing every sign of a potential addict? I'm not sure what I'm asking anymore, please let me know what you think.

WRITING.TITLE: b'TV series?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I used to enjoy them, like I would binge watch something I like all day long. I knew of course that they're all like this but I'm feeling it so strongly I can't enjoy them anymore. I even think they're feeding me bad energies, like they're messing up with my mind dragging me further into some dramatic screenplay that I would subtly identify with in time. But on the other hand I am enjoying if you know what I mean, they're like narcotics.

WRITING.TITLE: b'Adults who started as a teenager?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I mean we're all older folks here right (probably also some very young persons in their 18/19 no offense)? But most of us are older than that right?\xe2\x80\xa6 so I'd like to ask  To those who started the behavior as a teenager, and carried it all along into adulthood, do you see any difference what you're doing now comparing to what you were doing at 13? I see no difference I'm twice that age now. If anything I'm more nostalgic (yeah), like I think of the good old times when I thought sh would help it all, and I repeat the act so I feel as much in control as when I was 13. It's kinda pathetic put this way, I was certainly not in control at 13 but time does the trick and it just seems way better than I am now.  But the fact is I no longer have a mind of a 13y/o. I browse madeofstyrofoam  frequently and I can't relate- I can't help thinking \xe2\x80\x9cthey're too young for this\xe2\x80\x9d and more thinking \xe2\x80\x9cthey don't understand\xe2\x80\x9d. WRITING.TITLE: b'Recommendations on apps for learning German vocabulary?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: What I'm looking for: -words with audio pronunciation  -words meaning in English (ofc) -sentences (so you see how the word is used) with audio pronunciations -sentences with translation in English   What I don't need  -repetitive spelling test  -words keep showing up asking if I know them already   At this point my best option seems to be wiktionary lol, they even include the etymology for each word and I LOVE that. But they don't have wordlists you can learn, you have to look up for the words and obviously I can't do that. Plus they don't have audio for sentences.  Any suggestions please? I'm not looking for a perfect match maybe something that comes close!

WRITING.TITLE: b'Question honn\xc3\xaate : qu\xe2\x80\x99est-ce qu\xe2\x80\x99il y a contre les suicidaires?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: (Pour celles et ceux inqui\xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9s jsuis pas suicidaire pour le moment, j'irai au travail demain matin comme je l'ai toujours fait, il ne s'agit pas d'une alerte.) J'aimerais pourtant poser la question.  Pourquoi en effet je ne comprends pas. J'en ai assez des \xc2\xab\xc2\xa0\xc3\xa7a ira mieux\xc2\xa0\xc2\xbb, on assume simplement que j'abandonne quelque chose dans une vie future, quand je je ne perds vraiment rien ?Que \xc3\xa7a aille mieux ou non c'est pas un probl\xc3\xa8me. Le probl\xc3\xa8me c'est qu'il y a vraiment rien dans le future! Qui souffre MAINTENANT souffrira toujours, on pourrait bien dire le contraire et \xc3\xa7a sera la m\xc3\xaame chose: on souffre maintenant.  Et la mort mettra fin \xc3\xa0 tout cela! Il se peut qu'on souffrira encore dans une autre vie, que rien n'ira mieux, sans doute pire, mais plus de CETTE VIE non ? On en est bel et bien sorti !  C'est pourquoi je ne comprends pas vraiment, pas du tout, pourquoi on est alert\xc3\xa9 au sujet et on veut qu'une personne suicidaire ne prenne pas l'acte. Pourquoi vraiment pourquoi?

WRITING.TITLE: b'What next ?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I'm almost ashamed to admit I've only (like truly mindfully) read Micheal Singer and Tolle so far\xe2\x80\xa6 Seen that many here are already quite advanced in the path. You guys you can meditate! You're feeling things inside you! You can tell one feeling/energy from another and not with words! Oh my that sounds like wonders to me.  I've came to realize however that I'm identifying more than I think with my problems. I've always known myself as a troubled person (I was and I am, so to speak), the thing is it's became like an unshakable part of \xe2\x80\x9cme\xe2\x80\x9d. And that's a neutral way to put it. What's even harder to admit to myself is that I'm somehow getting pleasure from an identification as such. Like every time I read about depression/anxiety/suicidal thoughts, I feel an itch scratched deep down in me, a shameful itch like in unspeakable parts, and it's now gently scratched. It's exhilarating even. Of course we know as a common sense that scratching an itch would probably revive it and make it worse, but I noticed the moment of satiation whenever such topics were brought up, and then followed by more overwhelming urges that I can't really describe (like yay ahahaaahaha now let's scratch that skin to the bones!).  So I saw in these reactions how deeply I'm identifying with the troubled part of me, and I think it's going to do me no good. How can I get rid of the old thought pattern, that has seated me in the role of \xe2\x80\x9cmentally disturbed\xe2\x80\x9d? I've found Tolle very helpful. I'd prefer not to read on some general introduction into the theories, and I'm looking for some more \xe2\x80\x9cpractical\xe2\x80\x9d (if that's the right word) guidance. Any recommendations please? Love and peace to you all!  Edit/tldr: I spoke about the main obstacle for me at the moment but I'm really asking for recommendations! Like what authors should I be looking into or what practices I might consider doing, since I'm a definite newbie here. I've been searching ofc and actually got a loooooong list noted but (pardon me for this), it's just too overwhelming, almost leaves me as perplexed as always, and it feels distant. Can I have some recommendations here if that's not too much to ask?

WRITING.TITLE: b'How can you be really seated in the present moment? Any advice or tips?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Like, I tried, but it's too much. Deep breathing, meditation, do something, just WATCH, worked for a while and next thing I know I broke my 7days streak in sobriety.  I know that dealing with drinking problems could be somehow different from nurturing overall consciousness. I still wanted to post the question here because the truest reason that made me want to stop drinking at all is that I think I should stop suppressing my problems and just numb all feelings with alcohol, in general its affects on my life aren't that much of a bother.  The problem is I CANT stay in the present moment! It's simply unbearable. If not alcohol it's going to be something else, and always something else so I distract myself, flee to wherever else than the here and the now.  How did you do that? To stay conscious?\xe2\x80\xa6 it's too hard. Is there any tips that can help? Thanks for listening

WRITING.TITLE: b'Feel like I\xe2\x80\x99m falling off the wagon'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: It's my sixth day sober and\xe2\x80\xa6 I'm no longer able to hold myself together. I've had a rough day at work and I'm in a paralyzing sadness, but the most important thing is, I don't see the point. For the whole week I was telling myself \xe2\x80\x9cit will pass\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cit's only illusional\xe2\x80\x9d, but now I realize that what made those talkings work is always that I still want something: less pain, peace of mind, etc. Now they all seem only fake. Why? For what? How is one suffering different from another? And if I'm not free from suffering NOW, how can I be free IN TIME? Please somebody tell me something  Edit: I've read all of your comments, again I can't ever thank you enough for the support. I'm sitting with a giant bottle of Diet Coke and I KNOW that I won't be drinking today, and not tomorrow, not ever again. Thank you my friends

WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I know. I know that by committing suicide I'm just running away from one suffering to throw myself into another (and very probably even harder). But how can it matter to the me in this moment? Ordinary people like I am don't know peace, what I know is running away, and I keep running. Isn't that what we all do? Maybe not in extreme acts like killing yourself but don't we all live in repression and denial? Not seeing the suffering as it is? (sorry if I'm not making sense) for me, I might embrace a firing hell just to get out from a icing vault, surely always suffering but I MADE THE ACT, which is all that matters in my mind. If I've been wiser I'd known that I should stay in the burn, and I'll see it pass away, for after all it's not real. But I'm not wise enough, I resort to fantasies of leaving it all, and sometimes it becomes irresistible

WRITING.TITLE: b'26 F4M anywhere'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Hi everyone!  I've actually tried several different ways to begin this post and they seemed either suspicious or weird or meaningless: to write about myself and the partner I want in life is even harder than I thought! Please bear with me a little.  To make this thing easier I'm going to put out the facts first.  Demographic facts: I'm 26 years old, female, Chinese, can assuredly be found in Shanghai till June 2023, when I'm expected to finish graduate studies.  Better-to-know-at-first facts:  I'm really uncomfortable in any kind of sexual intercourse, I know it's a community for asexual people but no harm mentioning.  I would by no means bear children and it's not negotiable, having a human being grow inside me is beyond my wildest horror, and after all, bringing new life to this world is against my ethics.  I smoke and I'm not proud of it, but well it's hard to change and I don't see any good reason to, not yet.  I have a long history of mental issues, mostly eating disorder and depression, got the bipolar diagnosis once but I think the doctor was mistaken. I won't say that I've outgrown that history, but I'm indeed getting stronger, why, I'm writing an ad looking for partner now, you bet I want some good things in life.  Let's see what else is looking bad on me\xe2\x80\xa6. I don't think I left many stones unturned, maybe I forgot something but later. Now there's something about me that cannot be shown by facts:  I'm not religious, but definitely not atheist. I'm very interested in religions (especially Buddhism) and spiritual practices.  I'm currently learning German, at first it's because I wanted to go for the vocational training in Germany, but I've been told that it's not such a good idea. But still, German is a beautiful language! I began by reading Kafka's Ein Landarzt, which has been my favorite for years, then I ventured to read Also sprach Zarathustra which was such a pleasure at first, until Zarathustra spoke of going to women with a whip. Why, if Nietzsche had the fame of the great misogynist like Schopenhauer did, I won't be as much disappointed, but most people only know him as the mad guy crying for a dead horse which makes his profile kind of loving. I actually cried like a broken hearted lover, why Zarathustra why, I love your teachings so much and you only want to whip me??? My recent reading is Das Ich und das Es, it's such a shame that the I and the it should be translated into the ego and the id which complicated everything.  (please ignore those nosense above) I'm interested in psychoanalysis, literature (as I'm a student of literature), language learning and philosophy, those are my \xe2\x80\x9cfancy\xe2\x80\x9d hobbies.  My \xe2\x80\x9cnot so fancy\xe2\x80\x9d hobbies are thrillers, horror stories, true crimes, basically anything that gives you a chill on the spine, or a turn in the guts. I'm kind of a daredevil at times (which means when I'm not too lazy to move), and enjoy doing dangerous or unusual things just for the fun of it. I went to visit the cemetery at night because I couldn't sleep, made a ladder myself from shelves and chair to climb into my dorm window on the second floor when I didn't have keys, and I can ride a bike with hands off! Ah those are happy moments!  I'm not sure which city I'm going to be in after I graduate, hopefully I find a job in Europe, hopefully.  What I'm looking for is some serious, long-term relationship. I know you can't push such things and serious commitments are intimidating, but I speak of the ideal case scenario, and maybe in a very long time. What I forgot to mention above is that I'm also extremely introvert, I have no friends in life, barely some acquaintances, because most times I'd just keep to myself, how could you expect to make friends like that? But really, social with people even people you like is exhausting. I don't know if the metaphor is inappropriate but my want for long committed relationship is kind of like choosing good tv series (once chosen you get to watch for months even years) over good films, I want company and I don't like the trying and choosing period, I want to find someone and stick to the choice.  Well I can't really say what I expect in you\xe2\x80\xa6 basically anyone who's still reading here, and is interested, or have any further questions, please feel free to contact me.

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: oh no!!... please hear me out. What I did was a part-time job, when I was still in college. So if the issue is not obvious....why didn't my employer have an interpretor that works just for him? Because he don't need one, best option for him was to hire one from local college just for the occasion. So as many employers. The issue is, interpreting occasions are relatively rare, especially with the covid. So either I work freelance with is highly unstable and, I have to say, very stressing because you're like constantly job hunting, especially as a beginner, I don't think I can handle that. Either some bigger companys do hire interpretors, I actually worked at some of them, and what I found out was, 'interpretor' is just a job title for them, what you really do is a lot of administrative work, and interpret when in need, so it's a hell of difference from what I did as a student, suppose I look for sth like what I enjoyed\\* 24days a month, such thing I don't think even exist.  I gave up the idea years ago

WRITING.TITLE: b'Any jobs that require a lot of field work or face to face communication?'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Hi, definitely can use some career advice here. I'm going to graduate in 2023 with MA in French language and literature. I've been thinking a lot on what I'm going to do and what I know for sure is that I hate teaching (as much as I suck at it so no regrets), and that I'm a horrible, horrible procrastinator (I basically can never meet the deadline for my assignments and such behavior hardly changed no matter how bad the consequenses). I also believed for a long time that I'd better look for less people interactions because I'm extremely introvert, easily stressed and have a history with really bad mental problems. So I thought there could be literally no possible job at all for me.    Lately though my mind has changed. I realized that my true stressor does not come from the outside world, and it's certainly not interaction with people that I fear. Actually I get the worst anxiety when I'm forcing myself to do the work that I (God knows why) procrastinate... I think maybe I'm just bad at work that are assigned to me with a deadline, and I be the master of my time in between as long as I get the work done is my nightmare scenario. On the contrary if there's no time in between, if what the work requires is instant reaction and even improvisation, I think I can do just fine. I remember on my last year in college I worked for two weeks as an interpretor in some florists seminar, and I actually enjoyed it. Now there are much fewer occasions as such due to the covid, but I think maybe there are similar jobs? No or very little assignements, lots of field work instead of sitting in the office? I really can't think of many jobs like this, God I know so little of what are the jobs out there in the world! Any suggestions please?

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Vielen Dank f\xc3\xbcr diese ausf\xc3\xbchrliche Antwort!!! (Ich werde darauf achten, dass ich in meiner zuk\xc3\xbcnftigen Bewerbung meine Asexualit\xc3\xa4t erw\xc3\xa4hne!) \r   Ich habe durchaus daran gedacht, direkt in den Arbeitsmarkt einzusteigen, aber ich glaube nicht, dass mein Abschluss ausreicht, um mit den Einheimischen um eine Stelle zu konkurrieren: Warum mich einstellen, wenn man einen franz\xc3\xb6sischsprachigen Deutschen einstellen kann? Und so wird es auch sein, wenn ich andere L\xc3\xa4nder in Betracht ziehe. Die meisten meiner Kommilitonen haben ein Studium in einem anderen Bereich absolviert, das ihnen eine Stelle in Frankreich eingebracht hat, was bei mir leider nicht der Fall ist. Und nat\xc3\xbcrlich kommt mein mangelndes Selbstvertrauen auch daher, dass ich gerade angefangen habe, Deutsch zu lernen, und das ist noch ein langer Weg bis dahin.

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Vielen Dank daf\xc3\xbcr! Ich bin auf der Suche nach einer Ausbildungsstelle, weil ich f\xc3\xbcr den weniger zufriedenstellenden Fall plane, der aber sehr wahrscheinlich ist. Was ist, wenn ich in Deutschland einfach keine Stelle finde? Um ehrlich zu sein, glaube ich nicht, dass mein Abschluss auf dem Arbeitsmarkt viel wert ist, es sei denn, er wird mit einem anderen Bereich kombiniert. Ich w\xc3\xbcrde gerne wissen, dass es andere M\xc3\xb6glichkeiten gibt, vielleicht schwieriger, aber machbar, wie ein sicheres Netz, und gerade f\xc3\xbcr dieses sichere Netz ist es jeden Moment wert, Deutsch von Null an zu lernen.\r   Langfristig w\xc3\xbcrde ich gerne einen Abschluss in einem anderen Bereich machen, und ich denke, ich m\xc3\xbcsste nach dem Bachelor wieder von vorne anfangen. Und im Moment kann ich das wirklich nicht in Betracht ziehen, denn ich muss mich erst einmal darauf konzentrieren, meinen Lebensunterhalt zu verdienen.

WRITING.TITLE: b'Fragen zur Ausbildung'
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: Hallo! Ich bin sehr verwirrt, also haben Sie bitte Verst\xc3\xa4ndnis f\xc3\xbcr mich.  Ich bin 26 Jahre alt, komme aus einem Nicht-EU-Land und mache 2023 meinen Master-Abschluss (in franz\xc3\xb6sischer Sprache und Literatur). Aus einigen Gr\xc3\xbcnden (nichts Illegales) habe ich vor Kurzem  beschlossen, mein Heimatland f\xc3\xbcr immer zu verlassen, und jetzt erw\xc3\xa4ge ich das Ausbildung.  Zun\xc3\xa4chst einmal m\xc3\xb6chte ich wissen, (nat\xc3\xbcrlich), welche Chancen ich h\xc3\xa4tte, eine Ausbildungsstelle zu finden. Versteht sich, dass ich als Ausl\xc3\xa4nderin (und ein bisschen zu alt daf\xc3\xbcr bin) weniger bevorzugt werde, aber wird es so sein, dass ich mich mehr anstrengen muss, um eine Stelle zu finden, oder ist es so gut wie unm\xc3\xb6glich? (Ich wei\xc3\x9f, dass das niemand sagen kann, aber bitte sprich einfach aus deiner Erfahrung oder was immer du denkst). Und ich nehme an, dass die Chancen je nach Fachgebiet unterschiedlich sind. Fallen Ihnen also Vorschl\xc3\xa4ge ein, welchen Studiengang man w\xc3\xa4hlen sollte? solche mit mehr offenen Stellen, die auf dem Arbeitsmarkt st\xc3\xa4rker nachgefragt werden (vielleicht weil Einheimische sie nicht w\xc3\xa4hlen) und daher eher von Ausl\xc3\xa4ndern eingestellt werden?  Eine andere Frage ist, ob die Ausbildungsverg\xc3\xbctung f\xc3\xbcr den Lebensunterhalt ausreicht... Ich habe auf einigen Websites gesehen, dass die Ausbildungsverg\xc3\xbctung ungef\xc3\xa4hr 800 Euro betr\xc3\xa4gt (das variiert auch sehr stark, aber ich spreche von der Allgemeinheit), reicht das zum Leben? und nat\xc3\xbcrlich meine ich ein sehr bescheidenes Leben. Wenn Sie von Azubis wissen oder geh\xc3\xb6rt haben, leben sie alleine oder brauchen sie noch famili\xc3\xa4re Unterst\xc3\xbctzung, um die Ausbildung zu absolvieren?  Ich wei\xc3\x9f, dass sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich sind, ich habe bereits angefangen zu lernen und habe nat\xc3\xbcrlich nicht die Absicht, mit weniger als flie\xc3\x9fendem Deutsch nach Deutschland zu gehen.  Vielen Dank f\xc3\xbcr Ihre Geduld! und bitte \xc3\xbcberlegen Sie, mir zu antworten

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: love the vibe ! didn't really understand what happened tho...

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: I think suicide is kinda like walking out from an exam bc you can't figure out the problems or simply dislike it too much. and the universe be like the school, you have to pass all of the exams to eventually free yourself, and there is endless time for you to try again and again if you didn't pass: you would just keep reincarnating, not necessarily into human form though. So I don't think suicide can help, nor is it a terrible choice as many think, it just won't make much difference, as the exams won't go away just bc you did, you surely have to face them again as long as you didn't pass.
